newsitem.title: CHINA: China jobless rate seen at 3.0-3.5 pct in 1997.
newsitem.headline: China jobless rate seen at 3.0-3.5 pct in 1997.

text.p: China's unemployment rate is expected to reach 3.0-3.5 percent in 1997, up from the 1996 level, the China Business Times said on Wednesday.
China's urban jobless rate was 2.98 percent at the end of September last year, official figures showed.
China has not announced a jobless rate for 1996, but officials have said the government wants to curb the level to 3.2 percent in 1996. Urban unemployment was 2.9 percent in 1995.
China's total labour force was expected to reach 743 million in 1993, including rural areas, while total demand for labour was projected at 646 million, it said.
China would have to create vacancies for 10.8 million new job seekers in 1997 and absorb 30 milliom workers laid-off from ailing state firms, it said.
The service sector was expected to absorb a rising number of surplus workers in urban areas in 1997, it said, but gave no other details.
